body_html:
What do you mean there was no GPU version for windows?
if you run the following command, you should get the GPU(Nvidia Cuda) version of tensorflow installed.

pip install tensorflow-gpu

We do have tensorflow GPU version available for windows 10, which also should be compatible with older versions of windows to some extent.

It is correct that you have to install CUDA and CuDNN yourself, as they are separate pieces of software which need to be distributed separately.

What do you mean there was no GPU version for windows?
if you run the following command, you should get the GPU(Nvidia Cuda) version of tensorflow installed.
pip install tensorflow-gpu

We do have tensorflow GPU version available for windows 10, which also should be compatible with older versions of windows to some extent.
It is correct that you have to install CUDA and CuDNN yourself, as they are separate pieces of software which need to be distributed separately.
body:
What do you mean there was no GPU version for windows?
if you run the following command, you should get the GPU(Nvidia Cuda) version of tensorflow installed.
```
pip install tensorflow-gpu
```
We do have tensorflow GPU version available for windows 10, which also should be compatible with older versions of windows to some extent.

It is correct that you have to install CUDA and CuDNN yourself, as they are separate pieces of software which need to be distributed separately.
